messages.title: A Message from Anneliese
messages.content: Dear Elector, It has been a pleasure to represent you in Parliament for the last five years. If re-elected, I promise to continue to serve the community which I grew up in. As the mother of a young family, I have seen first-hand the impact of Conservative cuts on our families. I will fight to properly fund our schools, daycare and transport services. I promise to protect our local jobs and public services from Tory cuts and unsafe trade deals. Only a majority Labour Government can end the crisis in our NHS. Our policies will deliver a fairer society. This time, every vote for Labour counts. Please don't leave it to chance. Please use your vote so we can elect a Labour Government which will deliver for the many not the few. I hope you will support me and Labour in the upcoming election.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increased funding for the NHS and free prescriptions.
A public vote on any Brexit Deal.
Real action to tackle the climate crisis and increased funding for renewable energy.
A real Living Wage of at least £10 an hour for all workers.
Real funding increases for Oxford's cash strapped schools. Scrap tuition fees.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour can stop the Tories in Oxford East.

issues.brexitEurope: A public vote on any Brexit Deal.
issues.economy: Labour will boost the pay in your pocket. This will be done by raising the minimum wage to at least £10 an hour for all workers and implementing a 5% pay rise for public sector workers.
issues.education: Increased funding for the NHS and free prescriptions. Real funding increases for Oxford's cash strapped schools. Labour will scrap tuition fees and introduce free lifelong learning.
issues.environment: Real action to tackle the climate crisis and increased funding for renewable energy. Only a Labour Government can tackle the Climate Crisis.
issues.health: Only a majority Labour Government can end the crisis in our NHS.
issues.labourEmployment: Labour will boost the pay in your pocket. This will be done by raising the minimum wage to at least £10 an hour for all workers and implementing a 5% pay rise for public sector workers.

community.content: Labour will make sure that housing is affordable for all.

endorsements.endorsement: Andrew Smith MP for Oxford East 1987-2017: 'Anneliese cares and works tirelessly for her constituents and for people all over the UK. She has helped many people locally solve problems with the NHS, public services and other issues. While working on Labour's Shadow Treasury team, she is making plans for a future Labour Government to fund and protect our public services. Let's vote to keep her as our MP.'
Climate Change Campaigner: 'Anneliese will campaign to tackle the climate crisis and support a Green New Deal.'

Former Teacher and Green PPC for Oxford West and Abingdon: 'Anneliese won me over on education. As a former headteacher, I know we need Labour’s primary school cash boost of £5,470 per child, per school soon.'

Student: 'Labour will deliver the funding our NHS and schools need, while stopping dangerous climate change. Please support Anneliese locally and keep a Labour Government in place nationally. There is no other serious candidate worthy of your vote.'

examples: Increased funding for the NHS and free prescriptions.
Labour will boost the pay in your pocket. This will be done by raising the minimum wage to at least £10 an hour for all workers and implementing a 5% pay rise for public sector workers.
Only a majority Labour Government can end the crisis in our NHS.
Labour will make sure that housing is affordable for all.
A Message from Anneliese
Dear Elector, It has been a pleasure to represent you in Parliament for the last five years.
Anneliese is the local choice. Anneliese lives locally in Rose Hill with her family. She knows and campaigns passionately for the needs of Oxford East.

Andrew Smith MP for Oxford East 1987-2017: 'Anneliese cares and works tirelessly for her constituents and for people all over the UK. She has helped many people locally solve problems with the NHS, public services and other issues. While working on Labour's Shadow Treasury team, she is making plans for a future Labour Government to fund and protect our public services. Let's vote to keep her as our MP.'

Real funding increases for Oxford's cash strapped schools.
Labour will make sure that housing is affordable for all.
